semantic_title: Stages of Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) Coding Guidelines
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 14. Chapter 14: Diseases of Genitourinary System > a. Chronic kidney disease > 1. Stages of chronic kidney disease (CKD)

content.full_text: The ICD-10-CM classifies CKD based on severity. The severity of CKD is designated by stages 1-5. Stage 2, code N18.2, equates to mild CKD; stage 3, codes N18.30-N18.32, equate to moderate CKD; and stage 4, code N18.4, equates to severe CKD. Code N18.6, End stage renal disease (ESRD), is assigned when the provider has documented end-stage renal disease (ESRD). If both a stage of CKD and ESRD are documented, assign code N18.6 only. (Evidence: pg no: 62, L69-L71)
content.summary: CKD is classified by severity stages 1-5 with specific N18 codes, with ESRD (N18.6) taking priority when both stage and ESRD are documented (Evidence: pg no: 62, L69-L71)

Step 3: If ESRD documented, assign N18.6 regardless of stage
Step 4: If no ESRD, assign appropriate stage-specific N18 code
Step 5: Match stage to severity level (mild, moderate, severe)
